title: Bank Angle Indicators

body.body: Inspect the bank angle indicators on the rider's footrests for wear. The bank angle indicators are worn out when 5 mm of the bank angle peg remains.
Bank angle indicators must be replaced when they have reached the maximum wear limit of 5.0 mm (service limit) in length.

Use of a motorcycle with bank angle indicators worn beyond the maximum limit (when the bank angle indicator is worn to a minimum 5 mm in length) will allow the motorcycle to be banked to an unsafe angle. Therefore, always replace the bank angle indicator pegs when they are worn to 5.0 mm (service limit) in length.
Banking to an unsafe angle may cause instability, loss of motorcycle control and an accident.
